error.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: There must be an error in our calculations.
error.translation[0].definitions[0].note: Error is rather formal and is mainly used when talking about computers or in some fixed expressions such as human error. In everyday English, people usually use mistake:
There must be a mistake somewhere.
error.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: a mistake when you are working on a computer, which means that the computer program cannot do what you want it to do
